pullRequest.body:
Add `instance : PartialOrder C_c(α, β)` using pointwise `PartialOrder β`, following [ContinuousMap.partialOrder](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ContinuousMap/Ordered.html#ContinuousMap.partialOrder)

---

Split from #20040

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3eb8e9c812](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21206/commits/3eb8e9c812bb0cb4ed8d1165b63b87adb2c800bc)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.CompactlySupported | 1491 | 1492 | +1 (+0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.CompactlySupported`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasCompactSupport.inf`
`+ HasCompactSupport.sup`
`+ coe_inf`
`+ coe_inf'`
`+ coe_sup`
`+ coe_sup'`
`+ inf`
`+ inf'_apply`
`+ inf_apply`
`+ instance [Lattice β] [TopologicalSpace β] [TopologicalLattice β] [Zero β] :`
`+ le_def`
`+ lt_def`
`+ partialOrder`
`+ semilatticeInf`
`+ semilatticeSup`
`+ sup`
`+ sup'_apply`
`+ sup_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I thought the lemmas `HasCompactSupport.sup` and `inf` should be in the file `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Support`, but I couldn't because of the effects of the import elsewhere. So I put them here temporarily.
Thank you for splitting! Could you prove things of the form "If `β` is a lattice, then so is `C_c(α, β)`"?

```suggestion
variable {β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace β] [Zero β] [PartialOrder β]
```
and remove it from below

```suggestion
instance sup : Max C_c(α, β) where max f g :=
  { toFun := f ⊔ g
    hasCompactSupport' := f.hasCompactSupport.sup g.hasCompactSupport }
```

```suggestion
  DFunLike.coe_injective.semilatticeSup _ coe_sup
```
Also makes sure you've stated `coe_sup` properly

```suggestion
  { toFun := f ⊓ g
    hasCompactSupport' := f.hasCompactSupport.inf g.hasCompactSupport }
```

```suggestion
lemma finsetInf'_apply {ι : Type*} {s : Finset ι} (H : s.Nonempty) (f : ι → C_c(α, β)) (a : α) :
```
Same everywhere else

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/ContinuousMap/CompactlySupported): add `partialOrder`

source.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/RieszMarkovKakutani) prove that the Riesz content is regular and define the Riesz measure

nodes.body: Thank you for splitting! Could you prove things of the form "If `β` is a lattice, then so is `C_c(α, β)`"?

I thought the lemmas `HasCompactSupport.sup` and `inf` should be in the file `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Support`, but I couldn't because of the effects of the import elsewhere. So I put them here temporarily.
